meta.seo_title: Free Introduction to Intellectual Property Textbook for Download
meta.search_description: Study intellectual property online free by downloading OpenStax's Introduction to Intellectual Property textbook and using our accompanying online resources.

title: Introduction to Intellectual Property
description:
Introduction to Intellectual Property provides a clear, effective introduction to patents, copyright, trademarks, and trade secrets. The text may be used by students and instructors in formal courses, as well as those applying intellectual property considerations to entrepreneurship, marketing, law, computer science, engineering, design, or other fields. The luminaries involved with this project represent the forefront of knowledge and experience, and the material offers considerable examples and scenarios, as well as exercises and references.

Introduction to Intellectual Property was originally developed by the Michelson 20MM Foundation, released under the title The Intangible Advantage.

Presented by Gary K. Michelson, M.D.

book_student_resources.resource_description: Congratulations! You've got a free textbook. Download this guide to learn how to use it.

Multiple sets of videos and playlists developed or curated by the Michelson 20MM Foundation. The animated videos were created to address core topics in Intellectual Property. The Entrepreneurs Guide to IP’ is a course offered through the University of Southern California’s Marshall School of Business, Greif Center for Entrepreneurial Studies. The course doubles as a speaker series and is designed to give students a practical, working knowledge of intellectual property.

book_student_resources.resource_heading: Udemy Course: Intellectual Property - Inventors, Entrepreneurs, Creators
book_student_resources.resource_description: This course by the Michelson Institute for Intellectual Property explains the basics of intellectual property policies and issues regarding patents, copyrights, trademarks, and trade secrets. The course is asynchronous and offered free of charge; users must enroll through Udemy to take the course.
Adapted from OpenStax College Success, this guide includes information about estimating time on tasks, avoiding procrastination, and using strategies to stick to your priorities.

book_faculty_resources.resource_heading: Class Outlines, Presentations, and Discussion Questions
book_faculty_resources.resource_description: These resources provide material and guidance for designing and conducting classes and lessons using the textbook. They were developed by several institutions and organizations to address multiple teaching scenarios, levels of depth, and student audiences.

book_faculty_resources.resource_description: The Michelson 20MM Foundation developed a series of additional assessments to accompany the textbook. They are provided in a PDF format, and have feedback separated from the questions so that they can be used in either a formative or summative manner.
book_faculty_resources.link_document_title: Intellectual Property Class Outlines, Discussions, and Presentations

book_faculty_resources.resource_description: OpenStax generates Docx files for each section of this textbook to provide an easy way for instructors who need to customize OpenStax content. The Docx files are converted automatically and may contain some conversion errors. These files are provided to instructors as a helpful resource, but the OpenStax website is the preferred method for students to access our books. Once these files are downloaded, they will no longer receive content updates from OpenStax. Docx files can be used in Microsoft Word, LibreOffice, OpenOffice, or uploaded to Google Docs by instructors for use there, if desired.

value.heading: Find a webinar
value.content: Learn more by attending one of our free webinars featuring OpenStax authors, staff, and partners.

rex_callout_blurb: New Highlight and add notes — it’s 100% free!
errata_content: All OpenStax textbooks undergo a rigorous review process. However, like any professional-grade textbook, errors sometimes occur. The good part is, since our books are web-based, we can make updates periodically. If you have a correction to suggest, submit it here. We review your suggestion and make necessary changes.
customization_form_subheading: Please select the modules (up to 10), that you want to customize with Google Docs.
customization_form_disclaimer:
Disclaimer

The following features and functionality are not available to teachers and students using Google Docs customized content:

  • Errata updates. OpenStax webview is updated at least twice yearly. Customized Google Docs will not receive these content updates.
  • Access to study tools. OpenStax webview has in-book search, highlighting, study guides, and more available for free. This functionality will not be available in Google Docs versions.
  • Formatting. Print books and webview have a specific design and structure format developed for those platforms. These functionalities are not available in the Google Docs versions.
customization_form_next_steps:
Next Steps

  1. Within two business days, you will receive an email for each module that you have requested access to customize.
  2. The link provided in the email will be your own copy of the Google Doc that OpenStax generated for you.
  3. Once you have accessessed the document you can make the changes you desire and share with your students. We recommend using the "Publish to the Web" functionality under the file menu for sharing with students.

value.title: Interface
value.description:
As the world’s largest producer of carpet tile and other flooring materials, Interface is everywhere. Their modular products foster a great degree of creativity and innovation in interior design and function, and allow their clients to have a positive impact on the world around them. Interface’s sustainability principles and initiatives -- Mission Zero and Climate Take Back -- have led to powerful community engagement and revolutionary technological enhancements.

This video is part of the OpenStax Business series, which showcases entrepreneurs and businesses with a focus on purpose, principles, and best business practices. It can be used with any OpenStax business textbook.

value.title: Alto
value.description:
Alto is a new ride-sharing company based in Dallas, Texas. Through its unique relationships with drivers and an intense focus on safety, Alto differentiates itself with a one-of-a-kind customer experience. Will Coleman and Alex Halbardier share their strategies for empowering employees and sustaining growth in an emerging and challenging business category.

This video is part of the OpenStax Business series, which showcases entrepreneurs and businesses with a focus on purpose, principles, and best business practices. It can be used with any OpenStax business textbook.

value.title: Evernote
value.description:
This video shares the story of Evernote, the leading note-taking and memory app. Business Development Manager Manav Khurana discusses the company’s founding, mission, culture, and future direction. He also shares Evernote’s commitment to its community and offers guidance for students. This video is part of the OpenStax Business series, which showcases entrepreneurs and businesses with a focus on purpose, principles, and best business practices. It can be used with any OpenStax business textbook.

This video is part of the OpenStax Business series, which showcases entrepreneurs and businesses with a focus on purpose, principles, and best business practices. It can be used with any OpenStax business textbook.

value.title: Google Home
value.description:
Google Home is an interconnected, interactive ecosystem that improves the way we live. Product lead Mark Spates discusses the ways Google focuses on its users’ experiences to innovate and evolve. He shares his outlook on the company’s future through its research into machine learning, AI, and natural language understanding. And he describes the journey of creatively exploring an array of problem-solving pathways.

This video is part of the OpenStax Business series, which showcases entrepreneurs and businesses with a focus on purpose, principles, and best business practices. It can be used with any OpenStax business textbook.

featured_resources_header: Resources for taking your course online
